content.prompt:
The editor of a local newspaper wants to know whether readers would be willing to pay an additional $1.00 per month for their monthly newspaper subscription in exchange for an extra weekly section featuring stories about local businesses. The editor plans to survey a random sample of readers, and if the editor finds convincing statistical evidence that more than 75 percent of readers support the change, the editor will implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section.

In the context of this situation, which of the following describes a consequence of a Type I error?

choices.label: The editor decides to implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section when the actual percentage of readers who support the change is greater than 75%.
The editor decides to implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section when the actual percentage of readers who support the change is not greater than 75%.
The editor decides to implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section when the actual percentage of readers who support the change is less than 50%.
The editor decides not to implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section when the actual percentage of readers who support the change is greater than 75%.
The editor decides not to implement the plan of starting the extra weekly section when the actual percentage of readers who support the change is not greater than 75%.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Identify key and relevant information to answer a question or solve a problem.
